answers.answer: Statins are linked with memory loss!There are more deaths from heart disease associated with LOW cholesterol levels than high cholesterol levels.Do you know what your current cholesterol are?If you don't, well maybe you should find out what they are.One therapy which you might want to look into is a ketogenic diet, which may address both memory issues and seizures.You need to find a neurologist and a dietitian, who are familiar with this therapy and  assess if you can be asuitable candidate.Best wishes,Niko

question: Hi,I'm 41 years old and I'm dealing with memory issues. I think that they have been apparent since I was a little kid (I was discussing this with my mother and she said she noticed a few things) after having an accident when I was little where I smashed my forehead into some concrete steps... I also suffer from epilepsy and it is thought that I have got some brain damage due to the seizures,  and on top of all that I also take several medications (including stains and anti-epileptics) which I recently discovered could be making it even.What I need help with is (of course)  remembering things. A minor example is that my wife can ask me to make the bed,  and pretty much as soon as she has said it I have forgotten she made this request....the major ones are forgetting my twice daily medications,  which are for epilepsy,  diabetes, heart condition and depression...I have tried setting alarms for things that are regular,  but if I am in the middle of something then I'll forget. I've tried making lists,  and I either forget to write them down or forget to consult it. If I get distracted then my memory pretty much forgets what needs to be done.I've seen consultants and they have said that my brain is fine (which the way I'm forgetting then it obviously isn't) although said there potentially brain damage,  but doctors are saying there is nothing that they can do.I don't know what to do,  it's grating on the family,  it's getting to my wife of 2 years and it can potentially have devastating consequences (I' very left the gas cooker on,  Kept the fryer plugged in, left the iron on the board while wandering off after answering the door or getting a phone call).Please,  does anyone have any ideas that can help?Thanks in advance for anyone who might be able to suggest something that can help.
title: Help with remembering?
